channel.title: Dexterous-manipulation on Balakumar Sundaralingam

item.title: Dexterous Manipulation
item.description: Advisor: Dr. Tucker Hermans Robots with multi-fingered hands and human-like tactile sensing allow for complex interactions with the environmnet. Consider a robot replacing a lightbulb or using a drill. These tasks while trivial for humans, remain challenging for robots. Current approaches to dexterous manipulation with robotic systems either require complete analytic models of the environment or extensive interaction with the object to learn a policy. This project focuses on performing dexterous manipulation with minimal information about the object.
